name: Colleen Bawn
description: The Colleen Bawn dates to at least 1903, when the recipe appeared in The Flowing Bowl by Edward Spencer. Driven by the spark of rye whiskey, the drink introduces two very big hitters in the realm of full-flavored liqueurs— Benedictine and green Chartreuse—and blunts their sometimes overwhelming impact with the richness of an egg.
recipeIngredient: nutmeg and ground cinnamon, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake very hard, without ice, until the egg is well mixed with the other ingredients, about 10 seconds. Add ice and shake again for about 10 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glasses; garnish with a grating of fresh nutmeg and ground cinnamon.
